sense.gloss: benevolence (esp. as a virtue of Confucianism), consideration, compassion, humanity, charity
one's father, one's old man, dad, pops
middle-aged (or older) man, old man, geezer
proprietor (of a restaurant, store, etc.), landlord
humanity and justice (esp. in Confucianism), virtue
formal greeting (between yakuza, street vendors, gamblers, etc.)

sdata.j: あいつは↑口↑↓くち↓ばかりで、↑誠意↑↓せいい↓がないね。↑巧言令色↑↓こうげんれいしょく↓↑少↑↓すく↓なし↑仁↑↓じん↓とはよくいったもんだ。
sdata.e: They say fine words are no virtue if they're insincere and that's him in a nutshell. He's all talk but doesn't mean a word of it.

sdata.j: ↑巧言令色↑↓こうげんれいしょく↓↑少↑↓すく↓なし↑仁↑↓じん↓。
↑泥棒↑↓どろぼう↓↑仲間↑↓なかま↓にも↑仁義↑↓じんぎ↓がある。
↑巧言令色↑↓こうげんれいしょく↓、鮮なし↑仁↑↓じん↓。
sdata.e: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.

sdata.j: ↑盗人↑↓ぬすっと↓にも↑仁義↑↓じんぎ↓。
sdata.e: There is honor even among thieves.

words.gloss: benevolence (esp. as a virtue of Confucianism), consideration, compassion, humanity, charity
one's father, one's old man, dad, pops
humanity and justice (esp. in Confucianism), virtue
